perturbation.original_text: 4.3      DISTRIBUTOR agrees to satisfy the annual and quarterly sale targets for          the Products set forth in Appendix 3 herein as mutually agreed to by          the parties hereof.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.3      DISTRIBUTOR agrees to use its best efforts to satisfy the annual and quarterly sale targets for the Products set forth in Appendix 3 herein. While targets are indicative of expected performance, failure to achieve them will not constitute a breach of this agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states the Distributor 'agrees to satisfy' the sales targets, implying a binding obligation. The modified text weakens this to 'best efforts' and clarifies that failure to meet targets is not a breach. This creates ambiguity because other sections may imply that meeting sales targets is crucial for the continuation of the agreement or for receiving incentives.

perturbation.explanation: The original warranty clause provides a standard warranty and outlines specific remedies. The modified version removes the explicit warranty statement and replaces it with discretionary 'support for defects'. This creates conflict since it is no longer a warranty, but can be interpreted as such. This is a contradiction, as the original implied a warranty but this statement means that a warranty may or may not exist. This introduces uncertainty as to the obligations related to product quality and defect resolution.

perturbation.changed_text: 20.1     All disputes, controversies and claims arising from or incidental to          this Agreement shall be resolved by both parties through friendly          consultation. If no resolution can be reached within thirty (30) days          following the date on which one party informed the other party his          intention to resolve this amicably, either party can engage in any action it deems suitable.
